metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.
metadata.keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website

content.text: Push the buttons to move the smiley:
content.html: Push the buttons to move the smiley:

content.text: To add images on a canvas, the getContext("2d") object has built-in image properties and methods.
content.html: To add images on a canvas, the getContext("2d") object has built-in image properties and methods.

content.text: In our game, to create the gamepiece as an image, use the component constructor, but instead of referring to a color, you must refer to the url of the image. And you must tell the constructor that this component is of type "image":
content.html: In our game, to create the gamepiece as an image, use the component constructor, but instead of referring to a color, you must refer to the url of the image. And you must tell the constructor that this component is of type "image":

syntaxHighlighting.text: function startGame() {  myGamePiece = new component(30, 30, "smiley.gif", 10, 120, "image");  myGameArea.start();}

content.code: function startGame() {  myGamePiece = new component(30, 30, "smiley.gif", 10, 120, "image");  myGameArea.start();}

syntax_highlighting.text: function startGame() {  myGamePiece = new component(30, 30, "smiley.gif", 10, 120, "image");  myGameArea.start();}

content.code_html:
function startGame() {
  myGamePiece = new component(30, 30, "smiley.gif", 10, 120, "image");
  myGameArea.start();
}

syntax_highlighting_data.text: function startGame() {  myGamePiece = new component(30, 30, "smiley.gif", 10, 120, "image");  myGameArea.start();}

content.text: In the component constructor we test if the component is of type "image", and create an image object by using the built-in "new Image()" object constructor. When we are ready to draw the image, we use the drawImage method instead of the fillRect method:
content.html: In the component constructor we test if the component is of type "image", and create an image object by using the built-in "new Image()" object constructor. When we are ready to draw the image, we use the drawImage method instead of the fillRect method:

syntaxHighlighting.text: function component(width, height, color, x, y, type) {  this.type = type;  if (type == "image") {    this.image = new Image();    this.image.src = color;  }  this.width = width;  this.height = height;  this.speedX = 0;  this.speedY = 0;   this.x = x;  this.y = y;   this.update = function() {    ctx = myGameArea.context;    if (type == "image") {      ctx.drawImage(this.image,         this.x,         this.y,        this.width, this.height);    } else {      ctx.fillStyle = color;      ctx.fillRect(this.x, this.y, this.width, this.height);    }  }}

content.code: function component(width, height, color, x, y, type) {  this.type = type;  if (type == "image") {    this.image = new Image();    this.image.src = color;  }  this.width = width;  this.height = height;  this.speedX = 0;  this.speedY = 0;   this.x = x;  this.y = y;   this.update = function() {    ctx = myGameArea.context;    if (type == "image") {      ctx.drawImage(this.image,         this.x,         this.y,        this.width, this.height);    } else {      ctx.fillStyle = color;      ctx.fillRect(this.x, this.y, this.width, this.height);    }  }}

syntax_highlighting.text: function component(width, height, color, x, y, type) {  this.type = type;  if (type == "image") {    this.image = new Image();    this.image.src = color;  }  this.width = width;  this.height = height;  this.speedX = 0;  this.speedY = 0;   this.x = x;  this.y = y;   this.update = function() {    ctx = myGameArea.context;    if (type == "image") {      ctx.drawImage(this.image,         this.x,         this.y,        this.width, this.height);    } else {      ctx.fillStyle = color;      ctx.fillRect(this.x, this.y, this.width, this.height);    }  }}

content.code_html:
function component(width, height, color, x, y, type) {
  this.type = type;
  if (type == "image") {
    this.image = new Image();
    this.image.src = color;
  }
  this.width = width;
  this.height = height;
  this.speedX = 0;
  this.speedY = 0;
  this.x = x;
  this.y = y;
  this.update = function() {
    ctx = myGameArea.context;
    if (type == "image") {
      ctx.drawImage(this.image,
        this.x,
        this.y,
        this.width, this.height);
    } else {
      ctx.fillStyle = color;
      ctx.fillRect(this.x, this.y, this.width, this.height);
    }
  }
}

syntax_highlighting_data.text: function component(width, height, color, x, y, type) {  this.type = type;  if (type == "image") {    this.image = new Image();    this.image.src = color;  }  this.width = width;  this.height = height;  this.speedX = 0;  this.speedY = 0;   this.x = x;  this.y = y;   this.update = function() {    ctx = myGameArea.context;    if (type == "image") {      ctx.drawImage(this.image,         this.x,         this.y,        this.width, this.height);    } else {      ctx.fillStyle = color;      ctx.fillRect(this.x, this.y, this.width, this.height);    }  }}

content.text: You can change the image whenever you like by changing the src property of the image object of your component.
content.html: You can change the image whenever you like by changing the src property of the image object of your component.

content.text: If you want to change the smiley everytime it moves, change the image source when the user clicks a button, and back to normal when the button is not clicked:
content.html: If you want to change the smiley everytime it moves, change the image source when the user clicks a button, and back to normal when the button is not clicked:

content.code_html:
function move(dir) {
  myGamePiece.image.src = "angry.gif";
  if (dir == "up") {myGamePiece.speedY = -1; }
  if (dir == "down") {myGamePiece.speedY = 1; }
  if (dir == "left") {myGamePiece.speedX = -1; }
  if (dir == "right") {myGamePiece.speedX = 1; }
}

function clearmove() {
  myGamePiece.image.src = "smiley.gif";
  myGamePiece.speedX = 0;
  myGamePiece.speedY = 0;
}

content.text: Add a background image to your game area by adding it as a component, and also update the background in every frame:
content.html: Add a background image to your game area by adding it as a component, and also update the background in every frame:

content.code_html:
var myGamePiece;
var myBackground;

function startGame() {
  myGamePiece = new component(30, 30, "smiley.gif", 10, 120, "image");
  myBackground = new component(656, 270, "citymarket.jpg", 0, 0, "image");
   myGameArea.start();
}

function updateGameArea() {
  myGameArea.clear();
  myBackground.newPos();
  myBackground.update();
   myGamePiece.newPos();
  myGamePiece.update();
}

content.text: Change the background component's speedX property to make the background move:
content.html: Change the background component's speedX property to make the background move:

content.code_html:
function updateGameArea() {
  myGameArea.clear();
  myBackground.speedX = -1;
  myBackground.newPos();
  myBackground.update();
  myGamePiece.newPos();
  myGamePiece.update();
}

content.text: To make the same background loop forever, we must use a specific technique.
content.html: To make the same background loop forever, we must use a specific technique.

content.text: Start by telling the component constructor that this is a background . The component constructor will then add the image twice, placing the second image immediately after the first image.
content.html: Start by telling the component constructor that this is a background. The component constructor will then add the image twice, placing the second image immediately after the first image.

content.text: In the newPos() method, check if the x position of the component has reach the end of the image, if it has, set the x position of the component to 0:
content.html: In the newPos() method, check if the x position of the component has reach the end of the image, if it has, set the x position of the component to 0:

content.code_html:
function component(width, height, color, x, y, type) {
  this.type = type;
  if (type == "image" || type == "background") {
    this.image = new Image();
    this.image.src = color;
  }
  this.width = width;
  this.height = height;
  this.speedX = 0;
  this.speedY = 0;
  this.x = x;
  this.y = y;
  this.update = function() {
    ctx = myGameArea.context;
    if (type == "image" || type == "background") {
      ctx.drawImage(this.image, this.x, this.y, this.width, this.height);
      if (type == "background") {
        ctx.drawImage(this.image, this.x + this.width, this.y, this.width, this.height);
      }
    } else {
      ctx.fillStyle = color;
      ctx.fillRect(this.x, this.y, this.width, this.height);
    }
  }
  this.newPos = function() {
    this.x += this.speedX;
    this.y += this.speedY;
    if (this.type == "background") {
      if (this.x == -(this.width)) {
        this.x = 0;
      }
    }
  }
}
